page.title: 07Transport Introduction
page.content: There are 3 different kinds of transport in Alvechurch, road, rail and the canal. By road there are 4 main bus services in Alvechurch provided by the Midland Red. The rail service runs from Redditch to Birmingham. The first train leaves Redditch at 7.11am, and the last train back from Birmingham is at 6.50pm. The trains do not run on Sunday. There is one garage with petrol and one for main services and paint respraying. There are many different kinds of boat on the canal, and many come from the Marina. The canal barges used to carry bricks from the brick works which has been closed for many years. The Alvechurch Marina is attached to the Birmingham and Worcester canal. By using the canal you can reach the River Severn at Worcester. The Marina is now a boating centre.
